metadata.section_title: Global Talent Endorsement application

chunks.text: ### Part 1- Global Talent Endorsement application
chunks.summary: This provision applies to applicants seeking a Global Talent endorsement. It requires them to demonstrate they meet the specified criteria and obtain an endorsement from a designated competent body. Critical conditions include submitting sufficient evidence and fulfilling any eligibility thresholds set by the endorsing authority.

It requires them to demonstrate they meet the specified criteria and obtain an endorsement from a designated competent body. Critical conditions include submitting sufficient evidence and fulfilling any eligibility thresholds set by the endorsing authority.

### Part 1- Global Talent Endorsement application

metadata.section_title: Validity requirements for a Global Talent Endorsement application

chunks.text:
### Validity requirements for a Global Talent Endorsement application

1.   GTE 1.1. A person applying for Global Talent endorsement must apply online on the gov.uk website on the specified form “Apply for Global Talent endorsement - stage 1.
2.   GTE 1.2. An application for Global Talent endorsement must meet both the following requirements: 
    1.   (a) the endorsement application fee must have been paid; and
    2.   (b) the application must be for endorsement by an endorsing body in the field relevant to the applicant.

3.   GTE 1.3. An application which does not meet all the validity requirements for a Global Talent endorsement may be rejected as invalid and not considered.
chunks.summary: Applicants for a Global Talent endorsement must apply online, pay the endorsement fee, and ensure the endorsement aligns with their field. Applications failing these validity criteria may be rejected without consideration.

### Validity requirements for a Global Talent Endorsement application

1.   GTE 1.1. A person applying for Global Talent endorsement must apply online on the gov.uk website on the specified form “Apply for Global Talent endorsement - stage 1.
2.   GTE 1.2. An application for Global Talent endorsement must meet both the following requirements: 
    1.   (a) the endorsement application fee must have been paid; and
    2.   (b) the application must be for endorsement by an endorsing body in the field relevant to the applicant.

3.   GTE 1.3. An application which does not meet all the validity requirements for a Global Talent endorsement may be rejected as invalid and not considered.

metadata.section_title: Eligibility requirements for a Global Talent Endorsement application

chunks.text:
### Eligibility requirements for a Global Talent Endorsement application

GTE 2.1. An application for endorsement must be made under one of the fields below and must meet the endorsement requirements for that field.
chunks.summary: Applicants seeking a Global Talent Endorsement must apply under a designated field and meet its specific endorsement criteria, including relevant qualifications or achievements. Eligibility is contingent on satisfying the field-specific requirements; exceptions are not specified in this excerpt.

metadata.section_title: Arts and Culture endorsement

chunks.text: ### Arts and Culture endorsement
chunks.summary: This provision applies to individuals seeking an Arts and Culture endorsement under the Global Talent route. Applicants must demonstrate exceptional talent and recognition in their field, with endorsement from a relevant designated body; certain thresholds and criteria are specified to qualify.
chunks.augmented_text:
Document: Immigration Rules Appendix Global Talent
Part: Immigration Rules Appendix Global Talent
Section ID: Arts and Culture endorsement
Section: Arts and Culture endorsement
Topic: endorsement

Summary: This provision applies to individuals seeking an Arts and Culture endorsement under the Global Talent route. Applicants must demonstrate exceptional talent and recognition in their field, with endorsement from a relevant designated body; certain thresholds and criteria are specified to qualify.

### Arts and Culture endorsement

metadata.section_title: Arts and Culture field track record requirements

chunks.text:
### Arts and Culture field track record requirements

1.   GTE 3.1. An applicant for endorsement in the field of Arts and Culture must satisfy the endorsing body that they have either been recognised as an exceptional talent, or someone with exceptional promise, in the field of arts and culture and: 
    1.   (a) be professionally engaged in producing outstanding performed, presented, distributed or internationally exhibited work; and
    2.   (b) show regular professional engagement in their field in the last 5 years; and
    3.   (c) if evidencing exceptional talent, show a substantial track record in at least 2 countries; and
    4.   (d) if evidencing exceptional promise: 
        1.   (i) be at an early stage in their career; and
        2.   (ii) show a developing track record in 1 or more countries.
chunks.summary: Applicants in Arts and Culture seeking endorsement must demonstrate either exceptional talent or promise by showing outstanding or developing professional engagement, with evidence of a substantial or growing international track record, respectively. Criteria include recent activity within the last 5 years and, for talent, recognition in at least 2 countries.
chunks.augmented_text:

### Arts and Culture field track record requirements

1.   GTE 3.1. An applicant for endorsement in the field of Arts and Culture must satisfy the endorsing body that they have either been recognised as an exceptional talent, or someone with exceptional promise, in the field of arts and culture and: 
    1.   (a) be professionally engaged in producing outstanding performed, presented, distributed or internationally exhibited work; and
    2.   (b) show regular professional engagement in their field in the last 5 years; and
    3.   (c) if evidencing exceptional talent, show a substantial track record in at least 2 countries; and
    4.   (d) if evidencing exceptional promise: 
        1.   (i) be at an early stage in their career; and
        2.   (ii) show a developing track record in 1 or more countries.

metadata.section_title: Arts and Culture field track record evidential requirements

chunks.text:
### Arts and Culture field track record evidential requirements

1.   GTE 3.2. An applicant must provide all of the following: 
    1.   (a) a CV which sets out their professional arts and culture career to date; and
    2.   (b) 3 dated letters of recommendation supporting the Global talent application of which: 
        1.   (i) 2 must be from well-established arts and culture organisations that the applicant has worked with in an artistic capacity, who are acknowledged as experts in the applicant’s field, and at least one of the organisations must be based in the UK; and
        2.   (ii) the third must be from another well-established arts and culture organisation, or an individual that the applicant has worked with in an artistic capacity, who has recognised experience in the applicant’s field.

2.   GTE 3.3. An applicant who is evidencing exceptional talent in their field must provide at least two of the following: 
    1.   (a) evidence from at least 2 countries (which can include their country of residence) of 2 or more examples of significant media recognition for their work as an individual or as a named member of a group or as a contributor; or
    2.   (b) evidence of winning, or significantly contributing to winning, at least 1 international award for excellence; or
    3.   (c) evidence from at least 2 countries (which can include their country of residence) of proof of professional appearances, performances, publications or exhibitions considered internationally significant in their field, or evidence of extensive international distribution and sales for their work as an individual or as a named member of a group or as a contributor.

3.   GTE 3.4. An applicant who is evidencing exceptional promise in their field must provide at least 2 of the following: 
    1.   (a) evidence from at least 1 country (which can include their country of residence) of at least 2 examples of recent media recognition for their work as an individual, as a named member of a group or as a contributor; or
    2.   (b) evidence of winning, or significantly contributing to winning, or significantly contributing to being nominated or shortlisted for, or being nominated or shortlisted for, at least 1 international award for excellence; or
    3.   (c) evidence from at least 1 country (which can include their country of residence) of proof of professional appearances, performances, publications or exhibitions recognised in their field, or evidence of international distribution and sales for their work as an individual, as a named member of a group or as a contributor.
chunks.summary: Applicants must submit a CV and three recommendation letters from established arts organisations, including UK-based ones. Those evidencing exceptional talent must provide media recognition, international awards, or significant international performances or publications, with at least two types of evidence required. Conditions include endorsements from recognized experts and specific international achievements.

        2.   (ii) the third must be from another well-established arts and culture organisation, or an individual that the applicant has worked with in an artistic capacity, who has recognised experience in the applicant’s field.

2.   GTE 3.3. An applicant who is evidencing exceptional talent in their field must provide at least two of the following: 
    1.   (a) evidence from at least 2 countries (which can include their country of residence) of 2 or more examples of significant media recognition for their work as an individual or as a named member of a group or as a contributor; or
    2.   (b) evidence of winning, or significantly contributing to winning, at least 1 international award for excellence; or
    3. 3.   GTE 3.4. An applicant who is evidencing exceptional promise in their field must provide at least 2 of the following: 
    1.   (a) evidence from at least 1 country (which can include their country of residence) of at least 2 examples of recent media recognition for their work as an individual, as a named member of a group or as a contributor; or

### Architecture field track record requirement

1.   GTE 4.1. An applicant for endorsement in the field of Architecture must satisfy the endorsing body that they have either been recognised as an exceptional talent, or someone with exceptional promise, in the field of architecture and: 
    1.   (a) be professionally engaged in producing outstanding presented, published or internationally exhibited work; and
    2.   (b) show regular professional engagement in their field in the last 5 years; and
    3.   (c) show either a substantial track record in at least 2 countries if evidencing exceptional talent, or a developing track record in at least 1 country if evidencing exceptional promise.

The criteria include international recognition and ongoing professional activity, with specific thresholds based on talent level.

chunks.text:
### Architecture field track record evidential requirements

1.   GTE 4.2. An applicant must provide all of the following: 
    1.   (a) a CV which sets out their professional architecture career to date; and

    3. 3.   GTE 4.4. An applicant who is evidencing exceptional promise in their field must provide at least 2 of the following:

metadata.section_title: Fashion Design Industry endorsement

chunks.text: ### Fashion Design Industry endorsement
chunks.summary: This provision applies to fashion design industry applicants seeking endorsement under the Global Talent route. Applicants must demonstrate recognized achievement or exceptional promise in fashion design and receive an endorsement from an authorized endorsing body. Critical conditions include meeting the specific criteria set by the endorsing body; exceptions or additional thresholds are not detailed here.
chunks.augmented_text:

Topic: sponsorship

Summary: This provision applies to fashion design industry applicants seeking endorsement under the Global Talent route. Applicants must demonstrate recognized achievement or exceptional promise in fashion design and receive an endorsement from an authorized endorsing body. Critical conditions include meeting the specific criteria set by the endorsing body; exceptions or additional thresholds are not detailed here.

### Fashion Design Industry endorsement

metadata.section_title: Fashion Design Industry field track record requirement

chunks.text:
### Fashion Design Industry field track record requirement

1.   GTE 5.1. An applicant for endorsement in the field of fashion design must satisfy the endorsing body that they have either been recognised as an exceptional talent, or someone with exceptional promise, in the field of fashion design and: 
    1.   (a) have a leading design role in the fashion business; and
    2.   (b) show regular professional engagement in the fashion design industry in the last 5 years; and
    3.   (c) if evidencing exceptional talent, show professional engagement in producing outstanding work that has been sold or exhibited internationally through catwalk or other exhibitions and a substantial track record in at least 2 countries; and
    4.   (d) if evidencing exceptional promise, show a developing track record in at least 1 country and professional engagement in producing outstanding work that has been recognised by leading industry players.
chunks.summary: Applicants applying for endorsement in the fashion design field must demonstrate either exceptional talent or promise by having a leading role, recent industry engagement, and international recognition or a developing track record in fashion design, with specific emphasis on sales, exhibitions, and recognition in at least one or two countries.
chunks.augmented_text:

Summary: Applicants applying for endorsement in the fashion design field must demonstrate either exceptional talent or promise by having a leading role, recent industry engagement, and international recognition or a developing track record in fashion design, with specific emphasis on sales, exhibitions, and recognition in at least one or two countries.

### Fashion Design Industry field track record requirement

1.   GTE 5.1. An applicant for endorsement in the field of fashion design must satisfy the endorsing body that they have either been recognised as an exceptional talent, or someone with exceptional promise, in the field of fashion design and: 
    1.   (a) have a leading design role in the fashion business; and
    2.   (b) show regular professional engagement in the fashion design industry in the last 5 years; and
    3.   (c) if evidencing exceptional talent, show professional engagement in producing outstanding work that has been sold or exhibited internationally through catwalk or other exhibitions and a substantial track record in at least 2 countries; and
    4.   (d) if evidencing exceptional promise, show a developing track record in at least 1 country and professional engagement in producing outstanding work that has been recognised by leading industry players.

metadata.section_title: Fashion Design Industry field track record evidential requirements

chunks.text:
### Fashion Design Industry field track record evidential requirements

1.   GTE 5.2. An applicant must provide all of the following: 
    1.   (a) a CV which sets out their professional fashion design career to date; and
    2.   (b) 3 dated letters of recommendation supporting the Global Talent application of which: 
        1.   (i) 2 must be from well-established fashion organisations that the applicant has worked with in a fashion design capacity, who are acknowledged as experts in the applicant’s field, and at least one1 of the organisations must be based in the UK; and
        2.   (ii) the third must be from another well-established fashion organisation, or an individual, that the applicant has worked with in a fashion design capacity, who has recognised expertise in the applicant’s field.

2.   GTE 5.3. An applicant who is evidencing exceptional talent in the fashion design industry field must provide at least 2 of the following: 
    1.   (a) evidence of winning, or significantly contributing to winning, or being nominated or shortlisted for, or significantly contributing to being nominated or shortlisted for, at least 1 international award for excellence; or
    2.   (b) evidence from at least 2 countries (which can include their country of residence) of at least 2 examples of significant media recognition for their individual work; or
    3.   (c) evidence of catwalk shows, presentations or exhibitions considered internationally significant in the fashion design industry; or
    4.   (d) evidence of extensive distribution and sales of their collections via internationally renowned retailers, their retail outlet or their ecommerce platform.

3.   GTE 5.4. An applicant who is evidencing exceptional promise in the fashion design industry must provide at least 2 of the following: 
    1.   (a) at least 2 examples of recent UK or international media recognition for their individual work or their work as a contributing designer; or
    2.   (b) evidence of support and sponsorship through one of the following: 
        1.   (i) British Fashion Council support schemes; or
        2.   (ii) Fashion East support scheme; or (iii)The Sarabande Foundation; or
        3.   (iv) The Centre of Fashion Enterprise; or
        4.   (v) an international organisation which the British Fashion Council is satisfied operates as its counterpart , outside of the UK; or

    3.   (c) evidence of at least 1 order placed by a luxury retailer or boutique; or
    4.   (d) at least 2 examples of evidence of recognition by leading industry players of an exceptional graduating collection.
chunks.summary: Applicants in the fashion design industry must provide a CV and three recommendation letters—two from UK-based and well-established fashion organizations. To demonstrate exceptional talent, they need to supply evidence of international awards, significant media recognition, or internationally acclaimed exhibitions. Conditions include verifying reputable endorsements and meeting specific recognition thresholds.

metadata.section_title: Film and Television endorsement

chunks.text: ### Film and Television endorsement
chunks.summary: This provision applies to applicants seeking endorsement under Film and Television category in the Global Talent route. It requires applicants to demonstrate recognized expertise and meet specified criteria for endorsement, with consideration given to exceptional talent and relevant experience; exceptions or thresholds are detailed in the eligibility guidance.
chunks.augmented_text:

Section: Film and Television endorsement
Topic: endorsement

Summary: This provision applies to applicants seeking endorsement under Film and Television category in the Global Talent route. It requires applicants to demonstrate recognized expertise and meet specified criteria for endorsement, with consideration given to exceptional talent and relevant experience; exceptions or thresholds are detailed in the eligibility guidance.

### Film and Television endorsement

metadata.section_title: Film and Television field track record requirement

chunks.text:
### Film and Television field track record requirement

1.   GTE 6.1. An applicant for an exceptional talent endorsement in the field of Film and Television must satisfy the endorsing body that they have been recognised as an exceptional talent in the field of film and television and show 1 of the following: 
    1.   (a) that they have won at any time a “Main Award” for their work as an individual which means: 
        1.   (i) an Academy Award; or
        2.   (ii) a British Academy of Film and Television Arts (BAFTA) (film, television, television craft, Cymru, Scotland, Games awards only); or
        3.   (iii) a Golden Globe; or
        4.   (iv) an Emmy Award; or

    2.   (b) in the last 10 years they have been nominated for, or made a significant contribution to winning, or being nominated for any of the Main Awards; or
    3.   (c) in the last 15 years, they have achieved a minimum of 2 nominations for the Main Awards for their work as an individual; or
    4.   (d) they have notable industry recognition for at least 2 separate productions through international distribution sales, media recognition and a specified combination of awards from Pact’s Notable Industry Recognition Awards List, as set out in [https://www.pact.co.uk/applying-for-talent-visas/notable-industry-recognition-awards-list.html](https://www.pact.co.uk/applying-for-talent-visas/notable-industry-recognition-awards-list.html)
chunks.summary: Applicants for exceptional talent in Film and Television must demonstrate recognition through major awards, recent nominations, multiple nominations over 15 years, or notable industry recognition for at least two productions, with specific thresholds and timeframes.

Section: Film and Television field track record requirement
Topic: eligibility

Summary: Applicants for exceptional talent in Film and Television must demonstrate recognition through major awards, recent nominations, multiple nominations over 15 years, or notable industry recognition for at least two productions, with specific thresholds and timeframes.

### Film and Television field track record requirement

1.   GTE 6.1. An applicant for an exceptional talent endorsement in the field of Film and Television must satisfy the endorsing body that they have been recognised as an exceptional talent in the field of film and television and show 1 of the following: 
    1.   (a) that they have won at any time a “Main Award” for their work as an individual which means: 
        1.   (i) an Academy Award; or
        2.   (ii) a British Academy of Film and Television Arts (BAFTA) (film, television, television craft, Cymru, Scotland, Games awards only); or
        3.   (iii) a Golden Globe; or
        4.   (iv) an Emmy Award; or

    2.   (b) in the last 10 years they have been nominated for, or made a significant contribution to winning, or being nominated for any of the Main Awards; or
    3.   (c) in the last 15 years, they have achieved a minimum of 2 nominations for the Main Awards for their work as an individual; or
    4.   (d) they have notable industry recognition for at least 2 separate productions through international distribution sales, media recognition and a specified combination of awards from Pact’s Notable Industry Recognition Awards List, as set out in [https://www.pact.co.uk/applying-for-talent-visas/notable-industry-recognition-awards-list.html](https://www.pact.co.uk/applying-for-talent-visas/notable-industry-recognition-awards-list.html)

metadata.section_title: Film and Television field track record evidential requirements

chunks.text:
### Film and Television field track record evidential requirements

1.   GTE 6.2. An applicant must provide all of the following: 
    1.   (a) a CV which sets out their professional film and television career to date; and
    2.   (b) 3 dated letters of recommendation supporting the Global Talent application of which: 
        1.   (i) 2 must be from well-established film and television organisations that the applicant has worked with in a film and television capacity, who are acknowledged as experts in the applicant’s field, and at least one of the organisations must be based in the UK; and
        2.   (ii) the third must be from another well-established film and television organisation, or an individual, that the applicant has worked with in a film and television capacity, who has recognised expertise in the applicant’s field.
chunks.summary: Applicants applying under the Film and Television track must submit a CV detailing their career and three supportive, dated recommendation letters—two from UK-based or recognized industry organizations and one from another respected entity or individual—demonstrating their professional track record in the field.

metadata.section_title: Digital Technology endorsement

chunks.text: ### Digital Technology endorsement
chunks.summary: This provision applies to applicants seeking the Global Talent visa in Digital Technology. They must secure an endorsement from approved endorsers demonstrating exceptional talent or potential in digital technology. Conditions include meeting specific eligibility criteria; exceptions are not specified.
chunks.augmented_text:
Document: Immigration Rules Appendix Global Talent
Part: Immigration Rules Appendix Global Talent
Section ID: DT 1.1
Section: Digital Technology endorsement
Topic: sponsorship

Summary: This provision applies to applicants seeking the Global Talent visa in Digital Technology. They must secure an endorsement from approved endorsers demonstrating exceptional talent or potential in digital technology. Conditions include meeting specific eligibility criteria; exceptions are not specified.

### Digital Technology endorsement

metadata.section_title: Digital Technology field track record requirement

chunks.text:
### Digital Technology field track record requirement

1.   GTE 7.1. An applicant for endorsement in the field of digital technology must: 
    1.   (a) satisfy the endorsing body that they have either been recognised as an exceptional talent, or someone with exceptional promise, in the field of digital technology in the last 5 years; and
    2.   (b) show one of the following: 
        1.   (i) if they are a technical applicant, that they have proven technical expertise with the latest technologies in building, using, deploying or exploiting a technology stack and building technical infrastructure; or
        2.   (ii) if they are a business applicant, that they have proven commercial, investment or product expertise in building digital products or leading investments in significant digital product businesses.
chunks.summary: Applicants seeking endorsement in digital technology must demonstrate either recognition as an exceptional talent or promise within the last five years. Technical applicants must prove expertise in current technologies, while business applicants need to show experience in digital product development or investment. Critical conditions include meeting the endorsing body's criteria and choosing the appropriate expertise pathway.

### Digital Technology field track record requirement

1.   GTE 7.1. An applicant for endorsement in the field of digital technology must: 
    1.   (a) satisfy the endorsing body that they have either been recognised as an exceptional talent, or someone with exceptional promise, in the field of digital technology in the last 5 years; and

        1.   (i) if they are a technical applicant, that they have proven technical expertise with the latest technologies in building, using, deploying or exploiting a technology stack and building technical infrastructure; or
        2.   (ii) if they are a business applicant, that they have proven commercial, investment or product expertise in building digital products or leading investments in significant digital product businesses.

metadata.section_title: Digital Technology track record evidential requirements

chunks.text:
### Digital Technology track record evidential requirements

1.   GTE 7.2. An applicant must provide all of the following: 
    1.   (a) a CV with career and publication history included; and
    2.   (b) 3 dated letters of recommendation from 3 different well-established individuals acknowledged as experts in the digital technology field, with detailed knowledge of the applicant’s work over a period of 12 months or more, supporting the Global Talent application, which include all of the following: 
        1.   (i) how the author knows the applicant; and
        2.   (ii) the applicant’s achievements in the relevant field; and
        3.   (iii) how the author considers the applicant shows exceptional talent or promise; and
        4.   (iv) the contribution the applicant would be expected to make to the UK digital economy.

2.   GTE 7.3. An applicant evidencing exceptional talent must provide at least 2 pieces of evidence for 2 of the following: 
    1.   (a) a proven track record for innovation as a founder or senior executive of a product-led digital technology company or as an employee working on a new digital field or concept; or
    2.   (b) proof of recognition for work beyond the applicant’s occupation that contributes to the advancement of the field; or
    3.   (c) they have made significant technical, commercial or entrepreneurial contributions to the field as a founder, senior executive, board member or employee of a product-led digital technology company; or
    4.   (d) they have demonstrated exceptional ability in the field by academic contributions through research published or endorsed by an expert.

3.   GTE 7.4. An applicant evidencing exceptional promise must: 
    1.   (a) provide at least 2 pieces of evidence for 2 of the following: 
        1.   (i) innovation as a founder of a product-led digital technology company or as an employee working on a new digital field or concept; or
        2.   (ii) a proof of recognition for work beyond the applicant’s occupation that contributes to the advancement of the field; or
        3.   (iii) they have made significant technical, commercial or entrepreneurial contributions to the field as a founder or employee of a product-led digital technology company; or
        4.   (iv) they have demonstrated exceptional ability in the field by academic contributions through research endorsed by an expert; and

    2.   (b) be at an early stage in their career.

4.   GTE 7.5. An applicant must provide evidence of any commercially successful established businesses, share ownership or businesses dissolved in the last 5 years where the applicant has been a founder or senior executive.
chunks.summary: Applicants seeking the UK Digital Technology Global Talent route must submit a CV, three expert recommendation letters detailing their achievements and potential, and evidence of innovation or recognition in the digital field. They must meet specific evidential thresholds, including demonstrating exceptional talent or a proven track record, with certain requirements varying based on the applicant’s level of recognition.

metadata.section_title: Science, engineering, humanities, social science and medicine fields endorsement

chunks.text: ### Science, engineering, humanities, social science and medicine fields endorsement
chunks.summary: This provision applies to applicants seeking endorsement in science, engineering, humanities, social sciences, and medicine fields. It requires demonstrating exceptional talent or promise through specific criteria, with eligibility contingent on meeting endorsing body standards and overcoming any applicable thresholds or exceptions.

Topic: sponsorship

Summary: This provision applies to applicants seeking endorsement in science, engineering, humanities, social sciences, and medicine fields. ### Science, engineering, humanities, social science and medicine fields endorsement

metadata.section_title: Science, engineering, humanities, social science and medicine fields track record requirement

chunks.text:
### Science, engineering, humanities, social science and medicine fields track record requirement

GTE 8.1. An applicant for endorsement in the field of science, engineering, humanities, social science and medicine must be an active researcher in an academic, industry or government research institution.
chunks.summary: Applicants seeking endorsement in science, engineering, humanities, social science, or medicine must be active researchers at academic, industry, or government research institutions; this requirement applies unless otherwise specified.
chunks.augmented_text:

Topic: eligibility

Summary: Applicants seeking endorsement in science, engineering, humanities, social science, or medicine must be active researchers at academic, industry, or government research institutions; this requirement applies unless otherwise specified.

### Science, engineering, humanities, social science and medicine fields track record requirement

GTE 8.1. An applicant for endorsement in the field of science, engineering, humanities, social science and medicine must be an active researcher in an academic, industry or government research institution.

metadata.section_title: Fast track endorsement

chunks.text:
### Fast track endorsement

1.   GTE 8.2. An applicant applying for endorsement on the fast track must provide evidence of one of the following: 
    1.   (a) that they hold, or have held in the 5 years before the date of application, a peer reviewed research fellowship or award named on the list published by the Royal Society, the Royal Academy of Engineering and the British Academy; or
    2.   (b) that they have been appointed to an eligible academic or research position at an approved UK Higher Education Institution or research institute named on the list published by the Royal Society, the Royal Academy of Engineering and the British Academy; or
    3.   (c) that they will be hosted or employed in a UK research organisation named on the UKRI published list and will provide critical contributions to work supported by a substantial research grant or award from an endorsed funder named on the UKRI published list.

2.   GTE 8.3. DELETED.
3.   GTE 8.4. An applicant applying for endorsement on the fast track under GTE 8.2.(c) must either: 
    1.   (a) direct independently, or under the supervision of a Principal Investigator, a unique research or innovation project and meet all the following requirements: 
        1.   (i) they must have a PhD qualification or equivalent research experience (including industrial or clinical research); and
        2.   (ii) they must actively participate in a relevant field in a University, research institute or industry; and
        3.   (iii) they must have their name or post listed on the grant or award as the Principal or co-investigator, Researcher Co-investigator, Post-doctoral researcher or Research Assistant, or an equivalent position acceptable to UKRI; or

    2.   (b) make critical contributions to research by providing core technical or domain excellence or in developing new technologies and methodologies and meet both the following requirements: 
        1.   (i) they must have a UK bachelor’s degree or equivalent overseas research degree or equivalent research experience (including industrial or clinical research); and
        2.   (ii) they must have research experience within a University, Research Institute or Industry.
chunks.summary: Applicants seeking fast track endorsement must demonstrate recent prestigious research awards, academic or research positions at UK institutions, or hosting/employment at UK research organizations with significant grant support; they must also lead or participate in research projects and meet specific academic or professional criteria.

metadata.section_title: Fast Track endorsement - evidential requirements

chunks.text:
### Fast Track endorsement - evidential requirements

GTE 8.5. An applicant on the fast track applying under GTE 8.2.(a) must provide written confirmation from an awarding body named on the list published by the Royal Society, the Royal Academy of Engineering and the British Academy that they hold, or have held in the last 5 years, an eligible peer reviewed fellowship or award.

1.   GTE 8.6. An applicant on the fast track applying under GTE 8.2.(b) must hold an eligible academic or research position at an approved UK Higher Education Institution or Research Institute named on the list published by the Royal Society, the Royal Academy of Engineering and the British Academy and they must provide both: 
    1.   (a) a job description setting out the duties and responsibilities of the position; and
    2.   (b) a statement of guarantee from the Director of Human Resources, or equivalent, which confirms: 
        1.   (i) the job was advertised, and an open competition was held, or where it was not, an explanation as to why not; and
        2.   (ii) the applicant has accepted the job offer; and
        3.   (iii) the job title and department in which the applicant will be based; and
        4.   (iv) the applicant: 
            1.   (1) has responsibility for academic, research or innovation leadership and development; or
            2.   (2) will direct or lead an individual or team research project or research programme of work; or
            3.   (3) will direct or lead an individual or team innovation project or innovation programme of work; and

        5.   (v) at least two references were received; and
        6.   (vi) at least three academic, research or innovation representatives were on the interview panel(s); and
        7.   (vii) at least one expert in the applicant’s field was on the interview panel(s), or at least one relevant expert, independent of the employing institution, was consulted before the job offer was made.

2.   GTE 8.7. An applicant on the fast track applying under GTE 8.2.(c) must provide a declaration from the Director of Human Resources, or equivalent at the UKRI-approved UK research organisation which confirms all the following: 
    1.   (a) that the applicant has accepted the job offer or hosting agreement; and
    2.   (b) the job title and department in which the applicant will be based; and
    3.   (c) that there is at least one year remaining on their employment contract or hosting agreement; and
    4.   (d) that they will provide critical contributions to work supported by a substantial research grant or award from an endorsed funder; and
    5.   (e) that they are essential to the execution of the grant or award; and
    6.   (f) that at least 50% of the applicant’s time will be spent working on the grant or award by the endorsed funder (Principal investigators and co-investigators can aggregate time spent on multiple eligible awards or grants to demonstrate this requirement); and
    7.   (g) that a robust recruitment process has been completed where the applicant was not named on the grant application.

3.   GTE 8.7A. An applicant on the fast track applying under GTE 8.2.(c) must show that the grant or award from an endorsed funder is worth at least £30,000, covers a minimum of two years; and is either funded by a one-off grant or award that has been won in open competition or attributed to a large institutional, renewable award that is subject to periodic peer review, by either: 
    1.   (a)providing a link to the grant or award on a UKRI-approved database the details on which would be checked by UKRI against the above requirements; or
    2.   (b)providing written confirmation of the grant or award from the endorsed funder that the above requirements are met.
chunks.summary: This provision applies to applicants seeking fast track endorsement under the UK Global Talent route. They must provide evidence of either a peer-reviewed fellowship or an academic/research position at a UK recognized institution, with specific documentation confirming eligibility, job duties, and the authority to lead research activities, subject to conditions and approval by designated bodies.

metadata.section_title: Full peer review endorsement for exceptional talent

chunks.text:
### Full peer review endorsement

1.   GTE 8.8. An applicant evidencing exceptional talent under full peer review endorsement must satisfy the endorsing body they have been recognised as an exceptional talent in the field of science, engineering, humanities, social science or medicine; and must: 
    1.   (a) be an active researcher in a relevant field, typically in a university, research institute or in industry; and
    2.   (b) have a PhD or equivalent research experience (including industrial or clinical research).

2.   GTE 8.9. An applicant evidencing exceptional promise under full peer review endorsement must satisfy the endorsing body they have been recognised as having exceptional promise in the field of science, engineering, humanities, social science or medicine; and must: 
    1.   (a) be an active researcher in a relevant field, typically in a university, research institute or in industry; and
    2.   (b) have a PhD or equivalent research experience (including industrial or clinical research); and
    3.   (c) be at an early stage in their career.
chunks.summary: Applicants seeking global talent endorsement must be recognized as having either exceptional talent or promise in science, engineering, humanities, social science, or medicine, evidencing active research in relevant fields with a PhD or equivalent. Exceptional talent applicants require full peer review endorsement, while those with exceptional promise must demonstrate early career status; both must be affiliated with research institutions or industry.

    2.   (b) have a PhD or equivalent research experience (including industrial or clinical research); and
    3.   (c) be at an early stage in their career.

metadata.section_title: Full peer review endorsement evidential requirements

chunks.text:
### Full peer review endorsement evidential requirements

1.   GTE 8.10. A full peer review endorsement applicant must: 
    1.   (a) provide a CV which sets out their career and publication history; and
    2.   (b) provide a letter of personal recommendation from an eminent person resident in the UK supporting the Global Talent application which includes all of the following: 
        1.   (i) how the author knows the applicant; and
        2.   (ii) the applicant’s achievements in the relevant field; and
        3.   (iii) how the author considers the applicant shows exceptional talent or promise; and
        4.   (iv) the contribution the applicant would be expected to make to UK research and innovation excellence and wider society; and

    3.   (c) if evidencing exceptional talent, provide a letter from an additional eminent person in the applicant’s field, which includes all of the following: 
        1.   (i) a statement confirming that the author is a senior member of a reputable UK organisation concerned with research or innovation in the applicant’s field; and
        2.   (ii) how the author considers the applicant’s work to show exceptional talent; and
        3.   (iii) the contribution the applicant would be expected to make to UK research or innovation excellence and wider society; and
        4.   (iv) a statement confirming that the author’s assessment is provided on the basis of their capacity as an objective expert in their field and is an objective assessment of the applicant’s reputation in the field, notwithstanding any personal knowledge they may have of the applicant or any direct involvement they may have (or previously have had) in the applicant’s work.
chunks.summary: Applicants seeking a full peer review endorsement must submit a CV detailing their career and publications, along with recommendation letters from UK eminent experts confirming their achievements, exceptional talent, and potential contributions to UK research and society. Additional evidence is required if demonstrating exceptional talent, including statements from senior UK research or innovation leaders. Critical conditions include providing clear, expert-driven evidence and ensuring recommendations are objective.

Part: Immigration Rules Appendix Global Talent
Section ID: GTE 8.10
Section: Full peer review endorsement evidential requirements
Topic: eligibility

Summary: Applicants seeking a full peer review endorsement must submit a CV detailing their career and publications, along with recommendation letters from UK eminent experts confirming their achievements, exceptional talent, and potential contributions to UK research and society. Additional evidence is required if demonstrating exceptional talent, including statements from senior UK research or innovation leaders. Critical conditions include providing clear, expert-driven evidence and ensuring recommendations are objective.

### Full peer review endorsement evidential requirements

1.   GTE 8.10. A full peer review endorsement applicant must: 
    1.   (a) provide a CV which sets out their career and publication history; and
    2.   (b) provide a letter of personal recommendation from an eminent person resident in the UK supporting the Global Talent application which includes all of the following: 
        1.   (i) how the author knows the applicant; and
        2.   (ii) the applicant’s achievements in the relevant field; and
        3.   (iii) how the author considers the applicant shows exceptional talent or promise; and
        4.   (iv) the contribution the applicant would be expected to make to UK research and innovation excellence and wider society; and

    3.   (c) if evidencing exceptional talent, provide a letter from an additional eminent person in the applicant’s field, which includes all of the following: 
        1.   (i) a statement confirming that the author is a senior member of a reputable UK organisation concerned with research or innovation in the applicant’s field; and
        2.   (ii) how the author considers the applicant’s work to show exceptional talent; and
        3.   (iii) the contribution the applicant would be expected to make to UK research or innovation excellence and wider society; and
        4.   (iv) a statement confirming that the author’s assessment is provided on the basis of their capacity as an objective expert in their field and is an objective assessment of the applicant’s reputation in the field, notwithstanding any personal knowledge they may have of the applicant or any direct involvement they may have (or previously have had) in the applicant’s work.

chunks.text: ### Part 2- Application for entry clearance or permission on the Global Talent Route
chunks.summary: This provision applies to applicants seeking entry clearance or permission under the Global Talent Route. It requires demonstrating exceptional talent or promise in designated fields, with specific criteria and exceptions outlined for eligibility. Applicants must meet the relevant thresholds unless otherwise specified.
chunks.augmented_text:
Document: Immigration Rules Appendix Global Talent
Part: Immigration Rules Appendix Global Talent
Section ID: Part 2- Application for entry clearance or permission on the Global Talent Route
Section: Part 2- Application for entry clearance or permission on the Global Talent Route
Topic: leave-to-enter

Summary: This provision applies to applicants seeking entry clearance or permission under the Global Talent Route. It requires demonstrating exceptional talent or promise in designated fields, with specific criteria and exceptions outlined for eligibility. Applicants must meet the relevant thresholds unless otherwise specified.

### Part 2- Application for entry clearance or permission on the Global Talent Route

metadata.section_title: Validity Requirements for Global Talent route

chunks.text:
### Validity Requirements for Global Talent route

GT 1.1. A person applying for entry clearance or permission to stay on the Global Talent route must apply online on the specified form on gov.uk website as follows:

| Applicant | Specified form |
| --- | --- |
| EEA national with a chipped passport | Either: • Global Talent using the UK Immigration: ID Check app (when available); or • the forms listed below for applicants outside or inside the UK (as relevant) |
| Applicants outside the UK | Global Talent visa – stage 2 |
| Applicants inside the UK | Global Talent permission to stay – stage 2 |

1.   GT 1.2. An application for entry clearance or permission to stay on the Global Talent route must meet all the following requirements: 
    1.   (a) any fee and Immigration Health Charge must have been paid; and
    2.   (b) the applicant must have provided biometrics when required; and
    3.   (c) the applicant must have provided a passport or other travel document which satisfactorily establishes their identity and nationality; and
    4.   (d)the applicant must have been issued with an endorsement letter by a Home Office approved endorsing body or have been awarded a prize listed in Appendix Global Talent: Prestigious Prizes; and
    5.   (e)if applying for the first grant of permission on the Global Talent route using an endorsement letter, the date of application must be no more than 3 months after the date on the endorsement letter; and
    6.   (f) the applicant’s endorsement or prize must not have been withdrawn or suspended.

GT 1.3. If the applicant has in the last 12 months before the date of application received an award from a Government or international scholarship agency covering both fees and living costs for study in the UK, they must provide written consent to the application from that Government or agency.

GT 1.4. The applicant must be aged 18 or over on the date of application.

1.   GT 1.5. If applying for permission to stay, the applicant must be in the UK on the date of application.
2.   GT 1.5ZA. If applying for permission to stay, the applicant must not have, or have last been granted, permission: 
    1.   (a) as a Visitor; or
    2.   (b) as a Short-term Student; or
    3.   (c) as a Parent of a Child Student; or
    4.   (d) as a Seasonal Worker; or
    5.   (e) as a Domestic Worker in a Private Household; or
    6.   (f) outside the Immigration Rules.

1.   GT 1.5A. An applicant who is applying for permission to stay and has, or last had, permission as a Student, must fulfil one of the Conditions A or B below on the date of application: 
    1.   (a) Condition A: the applicant must have completed the course of study for which the Confirmation of Acceptance for Studies was assigned (or a course to which ST 27.3 of Appendix Student applies); or
    2.   (b) Condition B: the applicant must: 
        1.   (i) be studying a full-time course of study leading to the award of a PhD with a higher education provider which has a track record of compliance; and
        2.   (ii) have completed at least 24 months of study on that course.

GT 1.6. An application which does not meet all the validity requirements for the Global Talent route may be rejected as invalid and not considered.

Applications must be made within three months of endorsement issuance and meet all specified documentation and eligibility requirements.

metadata.section_title: Suitability Requirements for Global Talent route

chunks.text:
### Suitability Requirements for Global Talent route

GT 2.1. The applicant must not fall for refusal under Part Suitability.

1.   GT 2.2. If applying for permission to stay the applicant must not be: 
    1.   (a) in breach of immigration laws, except that where the Exceptions for overstayers section of Part Suitability applies, that period of overstaying will be disregarded; or
    2.   (b) on immigration bail

metadata.section_title: Entry requirements for Global Talent route

chunks.text:
### Entry requirements for Global Talent route

GT 3.1. A person seeking to come to the UK on the Global Talent route must apply for and obtain entry clearance on the Global Talent route before their arrival in the UK.

GT 3.2. A person applying for entry clearance on the Global Talent route must, if Appendix Tuberculosis applies, provide a valid medical certificate confirming that they have undergone screening for active pulmonary tuberculosis and that this tuberculosis is not present in them.
chunks.summary: Applicants seeking entry on the UK Global Talent route must obtain entry clearance prior to arrival and, where applicable, provide a valid TB screening certificate.

### Entry requirements for Global Talent route

GT 3.1. A person seeking to come to the UK on the Global Talent route must apply for and obtain entry clearance on the Global Talent route before their arrival in the UK.

GT 3.2. A person applying for entry clearance on the Global Talent route must, if Appendix Tuberculosis applies, provide a valid medical certificate confirming that they have undergone screening for active pulmonary tuberculosis and that this tuberculosis is not present in them.

metadata.section_title: Points requirement for Global Talent route

chunks.text:
### Points requirement for Global Talent route

GT 4.1. An applicant applying for entry clearance or permission to stay must be awarded 70 points in the table below.

| Requirement | Points available |
| --- | --- |
| An applicant making an initial application not relying on an endorsement: • has been awarded a qualifying prize listed in Appendix Global Talent: Prestigious Prizes. | 70 |
| An applicant making an initial application relying on an endorsement: • has been issued with an endorsement letter by an endorsing body; and • the date of application is no more than 3 months after the date on the endorsement letter; and • the endorsement has not been withdrawn by the endorsing body. | 70 |
| An applicant applying for an extension of their permission: • has met the earned money requirement; and • if they were granted their initial application using an endorsement, has not had their endorsement withdrawn by the endorsing body. | 70 |
| Total number of points required in each case | 70 |

GT 4.1ZA. An applicant who has held permission on the Global Talent route in the 12 months immediately before the date of application will be considered under the extension of permission requirements in GT 5.1.
chunks.summary: The UK Global Talent route applies to applicants seeking entry clearance or permission to stay, requiring 70 points. Eligible applicants must either have won a qualifying prize or possess an endorsing body’s letter, meeting specific timing and validity conditions, including no withdrawal of endorsement.

metadata.section_title: Points for initial application on the Global Talent route

chunks.text:
### Points for initial application on the Global Talent route

1.   GT 4.1A. Applicants relying on a prize in Appendix Global Talent: Prestigious Prizes to score points must meet both of the following requirements: 
    1.   (a) they must be the named recipient of the prize (prizes given to an organisation or group the applicant is associated with are not acceptable); and
    2.   (b) the prize issued by the relevant body must not have been withdrawn or suspended.

1.   GT 4.2. Applicants relying on an endorsement to score points must meet both of the following requirements: 
    1.   (a) the endorsement issued by the endorsing body must not have been withdrawn; and
    2.   (b) the endorsing body must continue to be approved by the Home Office on the date of decision.

GT 4.3. If the requirements in GT4.1A or GT 4.2. are met 70 points will be awarded for an initial application on the Global Talent route.
chunks.summary: Applicants seeking initial entry under the UK Global Talent route must meet criteria related to prestigious prizes or endorsements, ensuring prizes are awarded directly to them and are valid, and endorsements are approved and active. Once these conditions are satisfied, 70 points are awarded toward their application.

metadata.section_title: Points for extension of stay on the Global Talent route

chunks.text:
### Points for extension of stay on the Global Talent route

1.   GT 5.1. An applicant who has, or last had, permission on the Global Talent route and is applying for an extension of permission must meet the following requirements: 
    1.   (a) the applicant must have earned money in the UK during their last period of permission in either: 
        1.   (i) a field related to the subject matter of their prize if they were granted their initial application using a prize listed in Appendix Global Talent: Prestigious Prizes; or
        2.   (ii) the field in which they were previously endorsed in the Global Talent route if they were granted their initial application using an endorsement; and

    2.   (b) if the applicant was granted their initial application using an endorsement: 
        1.   (i) the endorsement letter issued by a Home Office approved endorsing body must not have been withdrawn; and
        2.   (ii) the endorsing body must continue to be approved by the Home Office on the date of decision.

GT 5.2. DELETED.

GT 5.3. If the requirements in GT 5.1. are met 70 points will be awarded for an application for an extension of stay on the Global Talent route.

Applicants must have earned money in the UK related to their initial prize or endorsement field, and if endorsed, their endorsing body's approval must remain valid; meeting these criteria grants 70 points toward extension.

metadata.section_title: Decision on an application on the Global Talent route

chunks.text:
### Decision on an application on the Global Talent route

GT 6.1. If the decision maker is satisfied that all the suitability and eligibility requirements for the Global Talent route are met the application will be granted, otherwise the application will be refused.

GT 6.2. If the application is refused the person can apply for an Administrative Review under Appendix AR: Administrative Review.
chunks.summary: Applicants on the Global Talent route must meet all suitability and eligibility criteria for their application to be granted; failure to do so results in refusal. Refused applications can be challenged through an Administrative Review process.

### Decision on an application on the Global Talent route

GT 6.1. If the decision maker is satisfied that all the suitability and eligibility requirements for the Global Talent route are met the application will be granted, otherwise the application will be refused.

GT 6.2. If the application is refused the person can apply for an Administrative Review under Appendix AR: Administrative Review.

metadata.section_title: Period of grant on the Global Talent route

chunks.text:
### Period of grant on the Global Talent route

GT 7.1. Permission will be granted for the period of years the applicant requests, up to a maximum of 5 years on each application.

GT 7.2. There is no limit on the total period of permission that may be granted on the Global Talent route.
chunks.summary: Applicants applying under the Global Talent route may be granted permission for up to 5 years per application, with no overall limit on total permission duration.

chunks.text:
### Conditions of grant on the Global Talent route

1.   GT 7.3. The grant will be subject to all the following conditions: 
    1.   (a) no access to public funds; and
    2.   (b) work (including self-employment and voluntary work) permitted except for employment as a professional sportsperson (including as a sports coach); and
    3.   (c) study is permitted, subject to the ATAS condition in Appendix ATAS.
    4.   (d) DELETED

metadata.section_title: Validity requirements for settlement by a person on the Global Talent route

chunks.text:
### Validity requirements for settlement by a person on the Global Talent route

GT 8.1. A person applying for settlement on the Global Talent route must apply online on the gov.uk website on the specified form “Settle in the UK in various immigration categories: form SET(O)”.

1.   GT 8.2. An application for settlement on the Global Talent route must meet all the following requirements: 
    1.   (a) any fee must have been paid; and
    2.   (b) the applicant must have provided any required biometrics; and
    3.   (c) the applicant must have provided a passport or other travel document which satisfactorily establishes their identity and nationality; and
    4.   (d) the applicant must be in the UK; and
    5.   (e) the applicant’s endorsement or prize listed in Appendix Global Talent: Prestigious Prizes must not have been withdrawn or suspended.

GT 8.3. The applicant must have, or have last been granted, permission on the Global Talent route.

GT 8.4. An application which does not meet all the validity requirements for settlement on the Global Talent route may be rejected as invalid and not considered.
chunks.summary: Applicants applying for settlement on the Global Talent route must submit an online form, pay fees, provide biometrics, a valid travel document, and ensure their endorsement remains valid. They must also be in the UK and have current or previous permission on this route; failure to meet these conditions may lead to rejection.

1.   GT 9.2. The applicant must not be: 
    1.   (a) in breach of immigration laws, except that where the Exceptions for overstayers section of Part Suitability applies, that period of overstaying will be disregarded; or
    2.   (b) on immigration bail.

metadata.section_title: Endorsement requirement for settlement by a person on the Global Talent route

chunks.text:
### Endorsement requirement for settlement by a person on the Global Talent route

GT 10.1. If the applicant was granted their initial application using an endorsement, the endorsement must not have been withdrawn by the endorsing body.

1.   GT 10.2. The applicant must have earned money in the UK during their last period of permission in the field in either: 
    1.   (a) a field related to the subject matter of their prize if they were granted for their initial application using a prize listed in Appendix Global Talent: Prestigious Prizes; or
    2.   (b) the field in which they were previously endorsed in the Global Talent route if they were granted their initial application using an endorsement.
chunks.summary: Applicants on the Global Talent route seeking settlement must have an active, non-withdrawn endorsement and have earned income in the UK within their endorsed or prize-related field during their last permission period.

metadata.section_title: Qualifying period requirement for settlement by a person on the Global Talent route

chunks.text:
### Qualifying period requirement for settlement by a person on the Global Talent route

1.   GT 11.1. The applicant must have spent a continuous period of 3 years in the UK if: 
    1.   (a) they were endorsed by the Royal Society, British Academy, Royal Academy of Engineering or UKRI; or
    2.   (b) they were endorsed under the exceptional talent criteria by Arts Council England or Tech Nation; or
    3.   (c) they were granted their initial application using a prize listed in Appendix Global Talent: Prestigious Prizes.

GT 11.2. The applicant must have spent a continuous period of 5 years in the UK if they were endorsed under the exceptional promise criteria by Arts Council England or Tech Nation.

1.   GT 11.3. The continuous period must consist of time with permission (not as a dependant) on any of (or any combination of), the following routes: 
    1.   (a) Global Talent; or
    2.   (b) Innovator Founder; or
    3.   (c) Skilled Worker; or
    4.   (d) T2 Minister of Religion; or
    5.   (e) International Sportsperson; or
    6.   (f) Tier 1, other than Tier 1 (Graduate Entrepreneur); or
    7.   (g) Scale-up; or
    8.   (h) Representative of an Overseas Business.
chunks.summary: Eligible applicants on the UK Global Talent route must have a continuous UK residence of 3 years (endorsed by scientific bodies or prize winners) or 5 years (endorsed under exceptional promise), with time spent under specific qualifying immigration routes, excluding dependants.

chunks.text:
### Decision on an application for settlement as a person on the Global Talent route

GT 15.1. If the decision maker is satisfied all the suitability and eligibility requirements are met for settlement on the Global Talent route the applicant will be granted settlement, otherwise the application will be refused.

GT 15.2. If the application is refused the person can apply for an Administrative Review under Appendix AR: Administrative Review.

metadata.section_title: Validity requirements for a dependent partner or dependent child on the Global Talent route

chunks.text:
### Validity requirements for a dependent partner or dependent child on the Global Talent route

GT 16.1. A person applying for entry clearance or permission to stay as a dependent partner or dependent child on the Global Talent route must apply online on the gov.uk website on the specified form as follows:

| Applicant | Specified form |
| --- | --- |
| EEA national with a chipped passport | Either (as applicable): • Dependant partner or dependant child using the UK Immigration: ID Check app; or • the forms listed below for dependant applicants outside or inside the UK as relevant. |
| Applicants outside the UK | Dependant partner visa Dependant child visa |
| Applicants inside the UK | If the dependant is applying at the same time as the Global talent applicant, they can be included in the form “Global talent – stage 2” where the form allows dependants to be added. Otherwise: – Dependant partner – Dependant child |

1.   GT 16.2. An application for entry clearance or permission to stay as a partner or child of a person on the Global Talent route must meet all the following requirements: 
    1.   (a) any fee and Immigration Health Charge must have been paid; and
    2.   (b) the applicant must have provided biometrics when required; and
    3.   (c) the applicant must have provided a passport or other travel document which satisfactorily establishes their identity and nationality; and
    4.   (d) the applicant must be applying as partner or child of a person (P) who: 
        1.   (i) has made a valid application for entry clearance or permission to stay on the Global Talent route that has not been decided; or
        2.   (ii) has entry clearance or permission to stay on the Global Talent route; or
        3.   (iii) is settled or has become a British citizen, providing that P had permission on the Global Talent route when they settled and the applicant either had permission as their partner or child at that time, or the applicant is applying as a child of P and the applicant was born in the UK before P settled.

GT 16.3. A person applying as a dependent partner must be aged 18 or over on the date of application.

GT 16.4 DELETED.

1.   GT 16.5. If applying for permission to stay, the applicant must be in the UK on the date of application.
2.   GT 16.5ZA. If applying for permission to stay, the applicant must not have, or have last been granted, permission: *(a) as a Visitor; or 
    1.   (b) as a Short-term Student; or
    2.   (c) as a Parent of a Child Student; or
    3.   (d) as a Seasonal Worker; or
    4.   (e) as a Domestic Worker in a Private Household; or
    5.   (f) outside the Immigration Rules.

1.   GT 16.5A. An applicant who is applying for permission to stay and has, or last had, permission as a Student, must fulfil one of the Conditions A or B below on the date of application: 
    1.   (a) Condition A: the applicant must have completed the course of study for which the Confirmation of Acceptance for Studies was assigned (or a course to which ST 27.3 of Appendix Student applies); or
    2.   (b) Condition B: the applicant must: 
        1.   (i) be studying a full-time course of study leading to the award of a PhD with a higher education provider which has a track record of compliance; and
        2.   (ii) have completed at least 24 months of study on that course.

GT 16.6. An application which does not meet all the validity requirements for a partner or child on the Global Talent route may be rejected as invalid and not considered.
chunks.summary: Dependent partners or children on the UK Global Talent route must apply online using specified forms, paying fees and health charges, providing biometrics, and valid identity documents. Applicants outside the UK use separate visa forms, while those inside can be included with the main applicant or apply separately, subject to conditions.

metadata.section_title: Entry requirement for a dependent partner or dependent child on the Global Talent route

chunks.text:
### Entry requirement for a dependent partner or dependent child on the Global Talent route

GT 18.1. A person seeking to come to the UK as a partner or child must apply for and obtain entry clearance as a partner or child on the Global Talent route before they arrive in the UK.

GT 18.2. A person applying for entry clearance as a partner or child on the Global Talent route must, if Appendix Tuberculosis applies, provide a valid medical certificate confirming that they have undergone screening for active pulmonary tuberculosis and that this tuberculosis is not present in them.

### Relationship requirements for a dependent partner on the Global Talent route

1.   GT 19.1. The applicant must be the partner of a person (P) and one of the following must apply: 
    1.   (a) P has permission on the Global Talent route; or
    2.   (b) P is, at the same time, applying for (and is granted) permission on the Global Talent route; or
    3.   (c) P is settled or has become a British citizen, providing P had permission on the Global Talent route and the applicant had permission as P’s partner at that time.

GT 19.2. The requirements of Appendix Relationship with Partner must be met.

GT 19.3. DELETED

metadata.section_title: Period of grant for a dependent partner or dependent child on the Global Talent route

chunks.text:
### Period of grant for a dependent partner or dependent child on the Global Talent route

1.   GT 24.1. A partner will be granted: 
    1.   (a) permission which ends on the same date as their partner’s permission on the Global Talent route; or
    2.   (b) 3 years’ permission if the partner was (or is being) granted settlement on the Global Talent route.

GT 24.2. A child will be granted permission which ends on the same date as whichever of their parents’ permission ends first, unless both parents have (or are being granted) settlement or British Citizenship, in which case the child will be granted permission for 3 years.
chunks.summary: Dependents (partners or children) on the Global Talent route are granted permission that either matches their partner’s permission duration or, if granted settlement, up to 3 years; children’s permissions end with the earliest parent’s, unless both parents have settlement or British Citizenship, then for 3 years.

chunks.text:
### Conditions of grant for a dependent partner or dependent child on the Global Talent route

1.   GT 24.3. The grant will be subject to all the following conditions: 
    1.   (a) no access to public funds; and
    2.   (b) work (including self-employment and voluntary work) is permitted, except as a professional sportsperson or sports coach; and
    3.   (c) study is permitted, subject to the ATAS condition in Appendix ATAS, if the applicant is over age 18.
    4.   (d) DELETED

chunks.summary: This provision applies to dependent partners and children on the UK Global Talent route seeking settlement. They must meet specific residency and character requirements, with certain exceptions for early settlement eligibility.

### Settlement as a dependent partner or dependent child on the Global Talent route

metadata.section_title: Validity requirements for settlement as a dependent partner or dependent child on the Global Talent route

chunks.text:
### Validity requirements for settlement as a dependent partner or dependent child on the Global Talent route

GT 25.1. A person applying for settlement as a dependent partner or dependent child on the Global Talent route must apply online on the gov.uk website on the specified form, “Settle in the UK in various immigration categories: form SET(O)”.

1.   GT 25.2. An application for settlement as a dependent partner or dependent child on the Global Talent route must meet all the following requirements: 
    1.   (a) any fee must have been paid; and
    2.   (b) the applicant must have provided biometrics when required; and
    3.   (c) the applicant must have provided a passport or other travel document which satisfactorily establishes their identity and nationality; and
    4.   (d) the applicant must be in the UK.
    5.   (e) the applicant must be applying as a partner or child of a person (P) who: 
        1.   (i) has made a valid application for settlement on the Global Talent route and that application has not been decided; or
        2.   (ii) is settled or has become a British citizen, providing P had permission on the Global Talent route when they settled and the applicant either had permission as their partner or child at that time or the applicant is applying as a child of P and the applicant was born in the UK before P settled.

GT 25.3. An application which does not meet the validity requirements for settlement as a partner or child on the Global Talent route may be rejected as invalid and not considered.
chunks.summary: Applicants seeking settlement as dependent partners or children on the Global Talent route must apply online using form SET(O), pay applicable fees, provide biometrics and valid travel documents, and be in the UK. They must also be linked to a main applicant who has a pending or settled Global Talent application, with specific conditions for children born in the UK or when the main applicant has settled or become a British citizen.

metadata.section_title: Suitability requirements for settlement as a dependent partner or dependent child on the Global Talent route

chunks.text:
### Suitability requirements for settlement as a dependent partner or dependent child on the Global Talent route

GT 26.1. The applicant must not fall for refusal under Part Suitability.

1.   GT 26.2. The applicant must not be: 
    1.   (a) in breach of immigration laws, except that where the Exceptions for overstayers section of Part Suitability applies, that period of overstaying will be disregarded; or
    2.   (b) on immigration bail.

metadata.section_title: Relationship requirement for settlement for a dependent partner or child on the Global Talent route

chunks.text:
### Relationship requirement for settlement for a dependent partner or child on the Global Talent route

1.   GT 27.1. The applicant must be the partner or child of a person (P) where one of the following applies: 
    1.   (a) P is, at the same time, being granted settlement as a Global Talent; or
    2.   (b) P is settled or has become a British citizen, providing P had permission as a Global Talent when they settled and the applicant either: 
        1.   i) had permission as P’s partner or child at that time; or
        2.   ii) is applying as a child of P, and was born in the UK before P settled.

1.   GT 27.2. The applicant must either: 
    1.   (a) have last been granted permission as a dependent partner or dependent child of the person (P) in GT 27.1.
    2.   (b) have been born in the UK and be applying as a child of the person (P) in GT 27.1.

1.   GT 27.3. If applying as a child, the applicant must meet the relationship requirement for settlement in Appendix Children.

GT 27.4. If applying as a partner, the requirements of Appendix Relationship with Partner must be met.
chunks.summary: This provision applies to dependents (partners or children) of Global Talent visa holders seeking settlement. The applicant must be directly related to a qualifying Global Talent individual who has been granted settlement, British citizenship, or if born in the UK, meet specific relationship criteria. Critical conditions include the applicant’s last permission status or UK birth, with specific relationship tests for children and partners outlined in other Appendices.

### English language requirement for a dependent partner or dependent child on the Global Talent route

GT 32.1. Unless an exemption applies, the applicant must show English language ability on the Common European Framework of Reference for Languages in speaking and listening to at least level B1.

GT 32.2. The applicant must show they meet the English language requirement as specified in Appendix English Language.
